\t\t\tPrayer is as essential as breathing to a healthy relationship with God through Jesus Christ. Disciples must cultivate a discipline of prayer, so that it becomes natural.\n\n
\t\t\tDavid, a man after God’s own heart, speaks of praying three times a day.

"But I call to God, and the LORD will save me. Evening and morning and at noon I utter my complaint and moan, and he hears my voice." 
Psalm 55:16–17
\t\t\tDaniel, a godly man known for his discipline in prayer, prayed three times a day.

"He got down on his knees three times a day and prayed and gave thanks before his God, as he had done previously." 
Daniel 6:10

His prayer in times of distress reflected a routine, not simply an emergency meeting with God. Gratitude governed his outlook.


			Prayer Trainer is a simple tool to help develop a discipline of prayer. It provides push notifications to pray three times a day – morning (as we begin the day with God), midday (in the thick of our day), and evening (as our day draws to a close). Each period of prayer could be as brief as 5 minutes.


			The Morning Prayer devotes the day ahead to God. A Scripture-rich prayer will help kick start your day, like caffeine for your soul. As you turn your face to God, commit your day to Him, looking to glorify and enjoy Him, laying the activities of the day before Him, enlisting His help to honor Him throughout.


			The Midday Prayer delights in God, resting in His presence. You will receive a portion of a psalm to reflect on and respond to God. Cast your cares upon Him and pray for others and your church.


			The Evening Prayer debriefs with God. Whether a separate time or as you lie on your bed to sleep, spend time reviewing your day, thanking God, confessing sin, entrusting yourself to Christ.


			May God grant you an awareness of His presence with you throughout each day.

This app is designed to help you develop and sustain a discipline of prayer through daily reminders and Scriptural prompts.


			Reminders are given three times a day (see Overview for rationale): morning, midday, and evening. Times for these notifications to your home screen are pre-set for 7 am, noon, and 7 pm. To set your own times, go to “Set Your Notifications.”


			Clicking on a morning notification will remind you of areas for prayer as you begin your day with God, and open up a Scripture-rich daily prayer, one for each day of the year.


			Clicking on a midday notification will remind you of areas for prayer as you walk with God, and provide a portion of a psalm to interact with Him.


			Clicking on an evening notification will remind you of areas for prayer as you review your day with God, responding to Him.


			If you missed or dismissed a notification and would like to return to it, click on Daily Prayer Prompts found on the home page of the app.

Concept: Stan Gale

 Developer: Eli Smith
